SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.magnos.io.bytes
Class ByteWriter

java.lang.Object
  org.magnos.io.bytes.ByteWriter

public class ByteWriter
extends java.lang.Object

A detailed writer of a BufferStream. This writer will write all data given to it expanding the underlying buffer as needed. The underlying buffer may become null however if there is not enough memory to store the buffer. Both the ByteReader and ByteWriter will accept null arguments since each nullable object writes a boolean for whether it is null or not. If the null byte is false a null object is returned, if the null byte was true the object that was written is returned.

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer

Constructor Detail

ByteWriter

public ByteWriter(BufferStream stream)
Instantiates a new ByteWriter.

Parameters:
stream - The stream to write to. If the stream does not have enough space for any data being written it will be expanded when required.

Returns:

order

public void order(java.nio.ByteOrder order)
Sets the byte order of the reader.

Parameters:
order - The new byte order of the reader.

putBoolean

public void putBoolean(boolean value)
Writes a boolean to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. A boolean takes up a single byte, a 0 for false and every other number means true.

Parameters:
value - The value to write to the stream.

putBooleanArray

public void putBooleanArray(boolean[] x)
Writes a boolean array to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the array, so if its null or empty and read back it will return null or empty. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the array is null, if its not null the length of the array is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the arrays elements are written. An array passed to this function must have fewer than 65536 elements to ensure when the array is read back it remains valid.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putBooleans

public void putBooleans(boolean[] x)
Writes an array of booleans to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putBuffer

public void putBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer x)
Writes the remaining data in the given buffer to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to.

Parameters:
x - The buffer to transfer data from.

putString

public void putString(java.lang.String s)
Writes a string to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the string, so if its null or empty and read back it will return null or empty. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the string is null, if its not null the length of the string is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the strings characters are written. A string passed to this function must have fewer than 65536 characters to ensure when the string is read back it remains valid. A string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and a byte for each of its characters.

Parameters:
s - The string to write to the stream.

putStringArray

public void putStringArray(java.lang.String[] x)
Writes a string array to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the array, so if its null or empty and read back it will return null or empty. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the array is null, if its not null the length of the array is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the arrays elements are written. An array passed to this function must have fewer than 65536 elements to ensure when the array is read back it remains valid. A string takes up a byte for a null marker, an unsigned short for the number of characters in it, and each character as a byte.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putStrings

public void putStrings(java.lang.String[] x)
Writes an array of strings to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. A string takes up a byte for a null marker, an unsigned short for the number of characters in it, and each character as a byte.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putUnicode

public void putUnicode(java.lang.String s)
Writes a unicode string to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the string, so if its null or empty and read back it will return null or empty. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the string is null, if its not null the length of the string is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the strings characters are written. A string passed to this function must have fewer than 65536 characters to ensure when the string is read back it remains valid. A string takes up 1 byte as the null marker, an unsigned short for its length, and 2 bytes for each of its characters.

Parameters:
s - The string to write to the stream.

putUnicodeArray

public void putUnicodeArray(java.lang.String[] x)
Writes a unicode string array to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the array is null, if its not null the length of the array is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the arrays elements are written. An array passed to this function must have fewer than 65536 elements to ensure when the array is read back it remains valid. A string takes up a byte for a null marker, an unsigned short for the number of characters in it, and each character as 2 bytes.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putUnicodes

public void putUnicodes(java.lang.String[] x)
Writes an array of unicode strings to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. A string takes up a byte for a null marker, an unsigned short for the number of characters in it, and each character as 2 bytes.

Parameters:
x - The array to write to the stream.

putEnum

public <T extends java.lang.Enum<T>> void putEnum(java.lang.Enum<T> x)
Writes an enum to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the enum, so if its null and read back it will return null. An enum takes up one boolean for a null marker, and an unsigned short for the ordinal of the given enum.

Type Parameters:
T - The enum type.
Parameters:
x - The enum to write to the stream.

putObject

public void putObject(java.lang.Object o)
Writes an object to the underlying stream using serialization. The object being written must be serializable or at least fit the requirements to be serialized. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the object, so if its null and read back it will return null.

Parameters:
o - The object to write to the stream.

putItem

public <T> void putItem(T item,
                        ByteWriter.WriteCallback<T> callback)
Writes an object to the underlying stream using a callback which serializes the object. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the written object.
Parameters:
item - The object to write to the stream.
callback - The callback to invoke to serialize the object with this writer.

putArray

public <T> void putArray(T[] x,
                         ByteWriter.WriteCallback<T> callback)
Writes an array to the underlying stream. If the underlying stream does not contain enough of free space to write it will be expanded before it is written to. This will save the state of the array, so if its null or empty and read back it will return null or empty. This is accomplished by writing a single boolean to whether the array is null, if its not null the length of the array is then written as an unsigned short (0-65535) and finally the elements in the array are written.

Type Parameters:
T - The type of the written object.
Parameters:
x - The array of objects to write to the stream.
callback - The callback to invoke to serialize the objects with this writer.
